editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but there’s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axis’ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

editorialNotes.tagline: Or just bundle up and enjoy the ride.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Still trying to get over it TBH

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

Terry Cavanagh’s Super Hexagon is quite simply one of the most challenging games we’ve ever played. A pulsating chiptunes soundtrack underscores the danger as swirling walls close in around you and you race to escape the contracting maze. With the geometric action heaping on the punishment (the easiest difficulty is appropriately labeled “Hard”), every small achievement feels like a massive victory, whether you’re topping your high score or overcoming a singularly tricky section.
editorialNotes.short: This is still one of our favourites. Few games are this satisfying to master.

editorialNotes.standard: So much more than a simple action game, Duet elevates the act of dodging falling blocks into something captivating, beautiful, even profound. A stirring soundtrack and striking visuals almost guarantee you’ll lose yourself in each stage, and as you learn the patterns and find yourself avoiding obstacles by sheer instinct, you’ll feel an overwhelming surge of triumph.
editorialNotes.short: Two vessels play out life’s duality.

editorialNotes.standard: This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

editorialNotes.tagline: Join the battle for Bikini Bottom

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.

ios.subtitle: It’s not a bug, it’s a feature

editorialNotes.short: Charge up the classic for your phone.

editorialNotes.tagline: A wild sprint to the finish

editorialNotes.short: Fast, gorgeous fights with great controls. This is one of our favourite action games.
editorialNotes.standard: Booming with anime-style action, Implosion feels like it was forged in some techno-marvel future. Spectacular visuals and spellbinding music bolster an epic tale that pits you—one of Earth’s few survivors—against the monsters who stole our homeworld. Fighting in your War-Mech battle suit’s a blast, with legions of ghastly foes ready for your lethal sword and fearsome firepower. If you like games long on style and ambition, this one’s for you.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: A classic that never gets old

Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: If they see you coming, it’s too late! Your mind is still your best weapon in the updated version of this sneaky 2006 action game.

Revenge is a dish served with epic property damage and plenty of attitude when a princess and her pet dragon decide they’re tired of getting captured. It’s pure destructive joy guiding this royal duo over (and under) a gorgeous fantasy landscape of fleeing knights, treacherous traps, and mighty bosses to smash. The game pops with personality—and its simple controls, slick level design, and upgradable equipment keep the challenge fun and fresh.

Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: You’re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. We’ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A well is usually one of the last things we’d want to fall into, but this retro-style shooter has us jumping in again and again. It’s a rush descending from rock to rock, blasting creepy creatures with your gunboots while nabbing crimson gems. Roguelike difficulty means you’re in for a challenge, but superb controls and nifty upgrades (including a jetpack, a drone and laser sights) give you all the help you’ll need. And with randomly generated levels, each journey feels as fresh and exciting as the last.

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror

editorialNotes.short: Plan your attack with robots and ricochets.
